moves.1. d4 c5: An unusual opening, but Black can easily regain the Pawn.
moves.3... Qxc5: Black wastes no time restoring material equality.
moves.4. e4: White attempts to re-establish a central presence.
moves.4... e5: Black counters by establishing one himself.
moves.6... Ne7: Black prepares to develop his K-side pieces.
moves.7. b4: Suddenly, the game gets explosively tactical!
moves.9. Nc7+: Black resigns, as his Queen falls to the Knight fork.
